children.subject: Personally, I would choose the industry experience and continue the research experience during Fall 2019. Imo it's good to diversify experience between industry and research
Definitely take the internship, research is imho easier to get into than what seems like a valuable offer where you'll also learn a lot. Plus you could do research during the academic year.
What upper division breadths would you recommend?

+1 to above responses. Would kill to get an internship but I'm stuck with classes + research over summer. Don't turn it down, breadths are pretty easy over the regular semester, especially if you choose the right ones, unless you have trouble with the English language (due to, say, it being your 2nd or 3rd language of choice).
Most likely you’ll be in industry all your life anyway. Might as well do research while you’re still in school

history.content: I think the answer is clear. Take the internship UNLESS you want to pursue grad school right after graduation, in which case research experience is more valuable.
While you are debating what to do in a pool of opportunities, I did not got anything :(

Hi, I'm a junior CS major.

So I got an offer from a mid-size tech company in mountain view to work as a back-end intern, and at the same time, the graduate student I work for in the lab asked me if I want to do research over the summer;

At first, I thought I should take the internship because I was planning to go to industry, and I didn't want to let go of the option of getting full time offer. Also, I can continue the research after summer.

However, I'm gradually doubting my decision more and more because I kind of want to do Masters now and might apply for 5th year program. I have a lot of breadths left, so I can take them during summer while doing research, and during school semesters, I can just focus on my major classes and put more time into research. 

What is your thought on this? Is it too risky to turn down the internship offer, when there's no guarantee I can get into masters program?

I do have an internship experience, but it wasn't in the US and I didn't learn that much.
history.subject: turn down internship for summer research and classes?
